properties.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains West; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 12:38PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
This is a special weather statement from the National Weather
Service in Riverton.

* WHAT...Snow will gradually taper off by 2 PM southeast of a
Worland to Thermopolis line. Total snowfall will generally be 2
to 3 inches southeast of this line. Snowfall in the Bighorn
Mountains will be similar except for 3 to 5 inch totals at the
south end of the range.

* WHERE...Southeast Bighorn Basin and the West Side of the Bighorn
Mountains.

* WHEN...Through 2 PM.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel through the Wind River Canyon could
be hazardous due to slick and icy conditions. Roadways in the
Bighorn Basin will gradually turn wet as temperatures rise into
the lower to mid 30s.

NWSheadline: Snow Will Decrease by Mid-Afternoon Monday
